Over the past several decades, the **Republic of Korea** has experienced one of the largest social and economic transformations. From a developing nation to one of the world's leading economies, South Koreaâ€™s rapid industrialization and investment in healthcare have significantly improved life expectancy. This analysis examines how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population have changed in South Korea over time, highlighting key trends in its development.

```{python}
#| echo: false

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")
```

```{python}
# Select a country
country_name = "Korea, Rep."
country_data = gapminder[gapminder["country"] == country_name]

# Plot trends over time
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))

sns.lineplot(data=country_data, x="year", y="life_expectancy", label="Life Expectancy")
sns.lineplot(data=country_data, x="year", y=country_data["gdp_per_capita"] / 1000, label="GDP per Capita (Scaled)")
sns.lineplot(data=country_data, x="year", y=country_data["population_millions"] / 1e6, label="Population (in millions)")

plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.title(f"Trends in Republic of Korea")
plt.legend()

plt.show()
```
